metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

srcinfo.srccontr: This dataset was created from digitizing mine maps developed from multiple mine operators. Credit should be given to the mine operators for developing the original mine maps.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created by scanning mine maps submitted to the DEP as part of Module 6.1 of the Application for Bituminous Underground Mine. Various scanners were used at different locations at different times. Once a map was scanned, most of the electronic images were post-processed using Adobe Photoshop CSx, to reduce the overall file size to a manageable size to allow our computers to display them efficiently. Some of the processes performed on the images include grayscaling, image size reduction, cropping, and autocontrasting. Once the images were a managaeble size, they were georeferenced using ArcGIS to base maps, including but not limited to 7.5 minute USGS topographic maps and PAMAP aerial photography. Next, the underground permit area boundaries on the map image were digitized and attributed.

attracc.attraccr: Several attributes contain details of mine names, operators, status, and other details of mining operations. These mine names, operators, status, and other details of mining operations change over time and there is NO guarantee that the data listed is the most accurate, recent, and/or complete.

horizpa.horizpar: This dataset was created by digitizing georeferenced mine maps of various/unknown accuracy and various/unknown coordinate systems to various base maps, including but not limited to USGS topographic maps and PAMAP aerial photography. Therefore horizontal accuracy of the polygons representing the mined out area are UNKNOWN.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of this dataset is to provide DEP staff and other environmental professionals with a spatially referenced dataset of underground permit area boundaries of active bituminous coal mines in Pennsylvania.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Pennsylvania state law requires those who wish to conduct mining activities within the Commonwealth submit and get approval by the Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) for permits related to those activities. These permits are written to cover various aspects of the mining operations, such as: reclamation, water quality protection, air quality protection, waste disposal and mine subsidence control. The DEP California District Office reviews permits related to Bituminous coal underground mining. Module 6.1 of the Application for Bituminous Underground Mine requires a Location Map be submitted with the permit. The Location Map should be a 7.5 Minute USGS map covering the area within one (1) mile of the underground permit area boundaries. This dataset contains the digitized underground permit area boundaries of the active underground bituminious mines in Pennsylvania based from the Location Maps submitted with the permit applications and permit renewal applications.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection, Bureau of District Mining Operations

The Originator and Publisher should be clearly cited in any product derived from this data. Any modifications to this data must be described in any digital or hardcopy product derived from this data. Any digital or hardcopy product derived from this data should not be larger than a scale of 1:24,000 and the following disclaimer should be added to the product: "The Active_Underground_Permit_Boundaries layer was provided by the Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection. The layer was prepared using information considered to be the best historic data available. The Department assumes no responsibility for the accuracy or completeness of this information."

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The county the mine is located in.
The mine operator that is operating the mine.
The permit number assigned to the mine by the DEP.
Type of coal removal method being used in the mine.

edom.edomvd: Room and Pillar method of coal mining.
Coal mine is actively removing coal.
The permit is still considered active, but final mine maps have been submitted.
The DEP received an application, but has not yet approved the permit.
The mine operator submitted, but then withdrawn all or part of the application.

attr.attrdef: The coal seam that the mining is occurring on.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
